questions.question: What would have happened if they had left the house earlier?
options: They catch the bus.
They would catch the bus
They would have caught the bus.
They had caught the bus.
questions.answer: They would have caught the bus.

questions.question: Choose the correct third conditional sentence:
options: If she has studied more, she would pass.
If she had studied more, she would have passed.
If she studied more, she will pass.
If she had studied more, she will pass.
questions.answer: If she had studied more, she would have passed.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'If we had arrived on time, we _____ the beginning of the movie.
options: saw
would see
would have seen
see

questions.question: Which option shows correct third conditional structure?
options: If he had eaten breakfast, he wouldn't be hungry.
If he eats breakfast, he wouldn't have been hungry.
If he had eaten breakfast, he wouldn't have been hungry.
If he had eaten breakfast, he wouldn't hungry.
questions.answer: If he had eaten breakfast, he wouldn't have been hungry.

questions.question: What is the correct third conditional sentence involving a job interview?
options: If I went to the interview, I would have got the job.
If I had gone to the interview, I would have got the job.
If I had gone to the interview, I would get the job.
If I go to the interview, I get the job.
questions.answer: If I had gone to the interview, I would have got the job.
